The lessons taught him that true freedom came not from reacting to the world but from actively choosing how to respond. He learned that the animal within him, driven by instinct, was not the only force at play. There was a conscious, deliberate part of him that could shape his experience. This practice of conscious choice was not just about managing stress but about living with intentionality. Paul knew that the world was full of challenges, but he also understood that he had the power to choose how he engaged with it. The lessons his mother had given him were not just tools for survival but a map for a life lived with purpose and awareness. As he continued to practice, he felt a deep sense of peace wash over him, a peace that came from knowing that he was in control of his own mind and body.
